name: Sofitel Legend The Grand Amsterdam

reviews.title: My Favorite Hotel in Amsterdam : The Grand Sofitel
reviews.text: If we are talking about the Grand Sofitel it is my all time favorite European Hotel...Location, service and overall experience top notch. Udo the concierge the best in the business...A MUST stay in Amsterdam. Rooms not cheap (But within reason) but well worth it...Promise

I had high hopes for this hotel, but was greatly disappointed (to say the least). This may be attributed to the less than friendly staff or pathetic service for breakfast. They did bring a welcome gift upon arrival. Although it was a nice gesture, it did not compensate for the lack of hospitality experienced during the remainder of the stay. The staff forced smiles and were extremely aloof. The concierge was not helpful in the least...except for the umbrella that we borrowed for the day.
reviews.title: Perfectly Pretentious

reviews.text: The business center is impressive. There's a great view of the property (it's opposite of the main building) and internet usage is free. It is open 24 hours, but you will require staff escort after 10 (you have to walk across the courtyard to get there).
reviews.title: Very dated
The Grand is Grand!
reviews.text: The property itself is grandiose and centrally located, but dated. Please be sure of where you are going... we walked two blocks in the wrong direction and ended up in the middle of the Red Light district at an unfriendly hour. There are also two "coffee shops" (side by side) on the walk back to the hotel. I detest the smell of hash, and it permeated the HALL where our room was located on Friday night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very large (deluxe room), especially by European standards. I didn't like the bathroom. There is not a separate shower and the water is not well contained. The beds are super comfortable, but that's standard with Sofitel. Decor is reminiscent of my Grandmother's bedroom. The window treatments matched the wall paper... so basically a continuous stream of English roses with a repugnant yellow background. Ick.
reviews.title: Grand hotel which lives upto its name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a special property. When you enter the courtyard of the hotel you feel as if you are taken back in time. While we usually prefer new modern hotels, this was a pleasant surprise with its quiet elegance and sophistication. I kept waiting for the Queen to exit and greet us. The staff is attentive and welcoming. The concierge, Udo, was unbelievable in assisting us in absolutely every way possible. He secured a car rental for rates below what I was able to find on Expedia.
reviews.title: Old World Elegance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the junior suite facing the canal. We were with in a block of Dam Square and the Red Light District but without the noise. The hotel pool/spa was a welcome respite after a day of walking on cobblestone.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!!!!

likes.liked: — Our fantastic Suite! It was bigger than our flat back home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was pricey given the rate of the dollar to the euro but was magnificent. The ala carte menu was more reasonable for a lighter breakfast. If you check the accor hotels website, there are periodic specials that include breakfast.
reviews.title: Weekend break with the best bed

likes.liked: — The huge big fluffy pillows and duvet - bed was excellent

reviews.text: This was a fabulous experience!
reviews.title: The perfect place to stay in Amsterdam!
Perfect (for what we wanted)
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on here, I decided to book this hotel for a romantic surprise weekend away for my Fiance and I, for his 30th birthday weekend. I telephoned the hotel direct, and told them it was a surprise for his birthday. They said they would try and upgrade us if there was the facility when we arrived. We took a taxi to hotel from Airport, and arrived late evening, and checked in without issue. When we arrived up at our room, we had been upgraded to the MOST beautiful suite I have ever seen. Beautiful bathroom, fantastic canal view, with HUGE windows. We spent some time in the pool and sauna area, and this was fantastic as on two occasions we were the only people in the fitness complex. Attention to detail was five star, including the towel and linen changes, the refilling of toiletries, and the general demeanour of the staff. The bed was fantastic.. slept for hours, which felt like days!! The location was amazing, just two minutes walk from dam square, and two minutes the other way to RLD. We had a beautiful champagne room service breakfast the morning of his birthday, and the hotel gave us a delft pottery replica of the hotel as a present with our room service filled with sweets! All in all it was the most fantastic stay ever, we totally totally enjoyed ourselves! 5****
We stayed in The Grand for 2 nights over Easter. The rooms were lovely, perhaps a little small but it certainly wasn't a problem.
reviews.title: Grand Hotel!

likes.liked: — Luxury in a very central location, gorgeous sunday brunch
likes.disliked: — Small pool with lots of kids!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had 2 rooms, one overlooked the lovely garden in the central courtyard, the other looked out to a small side street. As the person who had organised everything I was a bit miffed it was our room that had the non-view!
reviews.title: Great stay and very convienent

reviews.text: Bed was super-comfortable, Quality toiletries in the bathroom. Lots of towels and 2 big bath robes.
reviews.title: Great service, great location
Fabulous Weekend at The Grand
reviews.text: Pool was very small, but steam room and sauna were welcome.
Cocktails in the bar were great, the chocatini comes highly recommended!
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.text: Stayed here for business in a deluxe/superior room, which was large. Hotel is in a quiet location nicely situated just outside the chaos of the red light district.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice In Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving on a 6am flight I was worried that I might not be able to check in but the very friendly front desk staff took care of me.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel but service leaves something to be desired.
Fab Hotel
reviews.text: Hotel has easy access to trams and metro (about 2 blocks away).
Room was very clean, quiet and comfortable, large clean bathroom. Had both wireless and hard wired high speed internet.
reviews.title: pure luxury - excellent

reviews.text: Hotel has a very good restaurant on premises and very nice garden courtyard great for drinks and food.
reviews.title: Best in Amsterdam

likes.liked: — Elegant hotel in top location with intimate, secluded atmosphere
likes.disliked: — Thermostat did not shut itself off

description: SOFITEL LEGEND THE GRAND AMSTERDAM.Furnished with French elegance and grandeur, the hotel welcomes a variety of visitors, from the trendy Amsterdam elite to royal brides or famous international movie stars. In each of the rooms, the restaurant, the hallways and the beautiful garden terrace, design and history captivate and seduce everyone into visiting. ROOMS & SUITES.Sofitel Legend The Grand Amsterdam offers 177 spacious rooms, including 52 luxurious suites, amongst which 14 individually designed Suite Apartments: lodgings in 17th century canal houses. The rich history of the hotel is, as naturally, incorporated into the new architectural details in many ways. WELL BEING.Access to the relaxing SoSPA is complimentary for all hotel guests. It is the ideal place to unwind and pamper yourself. SoSPA houses an indoor heated swimming pool, a private Turkish steam bath, a Jacuzzi, a sauna, private treatment rooms and a SoFIT fitness area. INSPIRED MEETINGS.The 17 fully equipped banqueting and conference rooms, five of which are listed as historic monuments, provide the ultimate venue for meetings or conferences in Amsterdam. All rooms have natural daylight and are equipped with the latest technical facilities. BRIDGES RESTAURANT.The modern and trendy fish restaurant serves dishes with an emphasis on sea food and fish, mostly Dutch organic produce with a French twist. Bridges bar and lounge are the heart of restaurant, offering exclusive wines and vintage Champagnes.
